headline.main: $25,000,000 STOCK OFFERED.; National City Bank Owners May Get American International Shares.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2. -- Official announcement that the steamship Hocking, flying the American flag, had been requisitioned by the British Goverment without the formality of prize court proceedings was received by the State Department late today in a...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2. -- Official announcement that the steamship Hocking, flying the American flag, had been requisitioned by the British Goverment without the formality of prize court proceedings was received by the State Department late today in a dispatch from Consul General Young at Halifax, where the ship has been detained since she was seized by a British warship while on the way from New York to Norfolk.
docs.abstract: report that Hocking and Genesee have been requisitioned by British Govt. is officially confirmed

headline.main: BRITISH TAKE OVER TWO WAGNER SHIPS; Requisition the Hocking and Genesee Without Prize Court Proceedings. TO DRAW VIGOROUS PROTEST Kankakee and Whole American Transatlantic Fleet May Meet the Same Fate. BRITISH TAKE OVER TWO WAGNER SHIPS

docs.snippet: When the true history of this war is published it will be found that Germany was bankrupt before she declared war, and that financial ruin stared her in the face.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the true history of this war is published it will be found that Germany was bankrupt before she declared war, and that financial ruin stared her in the face.

headline.main: GERMAN FINANCIAL DANGERS; Her Economic Condition as a Cause of War and a Desire for Peace Now.

docs.snippet: MORE bugs and jungle fever than adventures," was the first thing that the modest Mr. Harry A. Franck, just back from a four years' tramp through South America, said to a TIMES man desirous of drawing him out about his remarkable journey.

headline.main: Tells of Four Years' Tramp in Latin America; Harry A. Franck, Safe at Home Again, Describes Dangers and Humorous Incidents of Record-Breaking Journey Through Wilds of American Continent

docs.snippet: Exports from the Port of New York in the week ended Dec. 4 included $10,000,000 worth of explosives, according to an analysis by the Foreign Trade Department of the National City Bank, and $8,000,000 of automobiles. The outflow of explosives and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Exports from the Port of New York in the week ended Dec. 4 included $10,000,000 worth of explosives, according to an analysis by the Foreign Trade Department of the National City Bank, and $8,000,000 of automobiles. The outflow of explosives and empty shells was smaller than the week before, but sized up well with the other large weeks of the year.

headline.main: LARGE EXPORTS FOR WAR.; Reshipment of Goods from Southern Lands Also a Feature.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 14. -- Money was in good supply and discount rates were dull today. American exchange started weak, but closed firm at 4.72 3/8 for cable transfers.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 14. -- Money was in good supply and discount rates were dull today. American exchange started weak, but closed firm at 4.72 3/8 for cable transfers.

headline.main: STOCKS DULL IN LONDON.; Government Securities Overshadow Other Issue.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14. -- Information was submitted to Secretary Lansing today containing the allegation that the Carranza de facto Government was not living up to the guarantee of religious liberty in Mexico given before foreign recognition was...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14. -- Information was submitted to Secretary Lansing today containing the allegation that the Carranza de facto Government was not living up to the guarantee of religious liberty in Mexico given before foreign recognition was accorded to that faction by the United States, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Bolivia, Uruguay, and Guatemala.
docs.abstract: Mgr. Kelley and Rev. T. V. Shannon confer on situation with Sec. Lansing

headline.main: PROMISES TO HELP MEXICAN CATHOLICS; Lansing Hears Charges of Oppression of the Clergy by Carranza Officials. PRIESTS ORDERED TO MARRY Mgr. Kelley Hears So from Yucatan, and Says They Are Forced to Dress Like Peons.

docs.snippet: All the republics to the South were represented in the reception given yesterday afternoon at the Hotel Astor in honor of the delegates to the Pan-American Scientific Congress, who are now gathering here preparatory to their meeting next Monday in...
docs.lead_paragraph: All the republics to the South were represented in the reception given yesterday afternoon at the Hotel Astor in honor of the delegates to the Pan-American Scientific Congress, who are now gathering here preparatory to their meeting next Monday in Washington.

docs.snippet: In nearly every large city in the country hundreds of business and professional men, among them some of the best-known bankers, lawyers, brokers, merchants, physicians, and men in other walks of life, in their respective communities, are undergoing a...
docs.lead_paragraph: In nearly every large city in the country hundreds of business and professional men, among them some of the best-known bankers, lawyers, brokers, merchants, physicians, and men in other walks of life, in their respective communities, are undergoing a systematic course of military training, with regular army and National Guard officers as their instructors.
